fields.summary: There should be a distinction between "0" estimates and "none entered"
Ability to specify "Later" release in Portfolio
Capture the pre-plan estimate of backlog items in Portfolio
Modify behavior when clicking a schedule bar
Scroll / highlight between backlog table and timeline in Live Plans
Bring back the Originally Planned field or provide a vehicle for saving baseline estimates to compare with current estimates

fields.description:
Currently I can only display the release report by chosing the release versions individually. It should possible to select several versions and aggregate them together into one, in order to see all issues across several versions. This is often the case when deployment happens across several components, e.g.
 * 2.2.0 is in fact
 ** 2.2.0-android
 ** 2.2.0-ios
 ** 2.2.0-web
fields.summary: Allow to group version for the release version report (nested version)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1543].
  {panel}

Assume there is a pool of developers that can be switching from team to team several times during the year. Each team can look for a developer in the pool, based on a skill set, and request her for a specific period. This improvement would also require the following filtering to make it really powerful:

* See on which releases is one person involved in a specific period.
* Filter the capacity view per team member
* Filter the backlog view per team member
fields.summary: Give more visibility per team member
Allow to show completed issues in schedule and reports pages

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have the issues in the release included at the Release Report export.

Currently, when exporting the Release Report from Portfolio for Jira Reports, it only exports the Release with the dates but there is no information about the issues inside each release to build a consistent report using the CSV file.

It would be good, when exporting the Release Report, to have an option to include the issues in the releases.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have the issues in the release included at the Release Report export
Start date in JIRA portfolio plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1209].
  {panel}

Hello,

We noticed that if we put same user in different teams, and plan for example:
20 hours in team A and 30 hours in team B, Portfolio will for this user calculate 50 hours per week.

Do you have in plan to prevent this behavior or to allow managers to choose if they want to summarize this times per users or not?


Thanks and Regards,
Jelena Radovanovic
fields.summary: Planned time for onne user in different teams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1706].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When importing issues from multiple sources that share issues (e.g. Project A, Project B, a board that contains issues from both projects, and a filter from Project A), it would be useful to be able to filter the issues based on the source of the issues on the plan.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Add a filter that allows issues to be displayed based on a single (or more) source on a plan.
fields.summary: Allow source filtering on plans
Support of completed sprints & done stories in Plan view
Import non-working days from Agile board that is used as a source for JPO

fields.description: Currently, in Jira portfolio the sprint report is ordered by created date. This does not represent the order of priority. A feature to allow the sprint report to be ordered by rank would be useful as it represents the user-defined order.
fields.summary: Order sprint report by rank

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1772].
  {panel}

The first option in Completion Date scope filter ("completed since the beginning of Open Sprint") seems to be mutually exclusive with all other time-based options (this month, this quarter, specific date interval, etc.)

Customer desires to see Open and Completed issues since specific date e.g. 1 Oct 2016 till now.

We observed that placing an issue into a column in JIRA Software that corresponds to one of the "green" statuses (i.e. status category is 'Done') makes it disappear from Portfolio scope view when this filter is applied. Switching to "open sprint" shows the issue, but then all other previously completed issues disappear.

I understand that there is a similar suggestion JPO-1405 already in the system and I will ask the customer to vote for it, but the original request is slightly different and can be phrased as this:

"When the starting date picked for the filter is before the start of the current sprint, those issues within the current sprint that don't have any resolution set but are in statuses with category 'Done' should be shown."

Also based on the definition of what is considered completed in a certain time period, it seems if an issue doesn't acquire a resolution after the sprint is closed - it won't show up at all, no matter what option is selected.

It seems what is really needed here is a configuration option to identify what date field to take to identify when an issue can be considered completed by a Portfolio plan.

Additionally, If something has been completed in the current sprint and the current sprint started AFTER the date chosen in the Completion filter any logical being would assume that a filter "Completed since October 1st" will catch the issue. Not so for Portfolio. This needs to be fixed.

If marking an issue with a status in "Done" category makes Portfolio treat it as "completed" then the date when the issue first entered this status must be picked up as the date for "Completed since..." filter.
fields.summary: Improve the behaviour of a completed Issue in Portfolio plan
View Over Allocated Sprints
Better zooming capability (Live Plans)
Refresh button to quickly update plan with changes from JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1423].
  {panel}

Issue linking should persist and be visible when a custom hierarchy is in use. 

As an example: 

|- Feature
  |---- Epic
        |---- Story

Epic Link is used to create the relationship between the Story and Epic. We use "Issue Link" "parent" to establish the link/hierarchy between the Feature and Epic. On import in the Portfolio Live Plan, and after adding the Feature issue type to the hierarchy in Portfolio, the Epic/Story link is honored while the Feature/Epic link is not. 

At this point we manually linked all the Features/Epics in Portfolio, and committed the changes. There is no visible relationship added on the single JIRA issues outside of Portfolio. 

Ideally the linking is imported along with the issues, and is also updated/maintained when changed within Portfolio.
fields.summary: Issue Linking with Custom Hierarchy in Live Plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1469].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Portfolio Planner, sometimes there's a need to add some other custom fields into the Scope view of Portfolio, like business value and other project specific information.
!Scope.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution
Since Portfolio is integrated with JIRA, having access to the JIRA custom fields would also be good.

h3. Workaround 
Not available
fields.summary: Add JIRA custom fields in Portfolio columns

fields.description: As a Jira Portfolio user I'd like to see a calendar view of the resources that are off that day, so during a planning session I can see who will be in and out of the office.
fields.summary: JIRA portfolio Team Calendar View for Resource's Time Off

fields.description:
When deleting a cross-project release the only option is to exclude child releases from the plan.

There is no option to delete the child releases from each project in Jira.

It would be useful to be able to delete each child release from each project when deleting a cross-project release. Otherwise the user has to manually go through each project and delete them.
fields.summary: Deleting a cross-project release does not delete child releases
Different blocks in timeline for different releases of the same initiative
Create and link existing issues should provide an immediate sync between JIRA and Portfolio
implement survey

fields.description:
h4. Problem

When a user is creating a new Portfolio plan or editing an existing one, the issues with fixVersion empty are added automatically to the plan. 

When the issue source has a high number of issues with fixVersion empty or not (more than 5000), the user is notified that he has too many issues on the plan and the user cannot click *Next* to reduce what needs to be in the plan's scope.

h4. Proposed solution

Portfolio should have a session in the *Select relevant releases* screen that displays issues not associated with releases, allowing the user to know why he is facing the warning about the number of issues, also allowing him to restrict the scope at the moment.
fields.summary: Display a session with issues not associated with releases on the "Select relevant releases" issue source screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1186].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
From the capacity view, we can only get information such as "Free capacity", "Planned capacity" and "Capacity utilization" of each team member.

h3. Suggested Solution
At the same location in UI, please have a link where it will redirect user to Issue Navigator to view all the issues that are assigned to the particular team member.
 
h3. Workaround 
One way to see the list of tickets assigned to a team member is to use the stories view and set the Grouping to "Members". That will show the stories that each member is working on per sprint.
fields.summary: Ability to drill down to the list of issues assigned to a team member in Capacity View
Display the Epic or Initiative's 'Theme' on linked issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1507].
  {panel}

*Existing Behavior*

Values shown for a parent issue (e.g. progress, story points) are aggregated from the child issues below it. Child issues that have been filtered out or excluded from the plan are not considered in this aggregation.

*Suggested Change*

It would be nice to have a "To-Do" view that is all of the uncompleted issues, but still has the roll-up of progress. 
* "In our view, there's no reason to have the progress show no progress when all of the completed issues are hidden, because then it's completely blank."
fields.summary: Always take completed issues into account when calculating progress regardless of whether they match the current filter settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1842].
  {panel}

A common use-case for us is for a plan to be built around the sequential scheduling of Epics, rather than the order of Stories on a backlog.
There should therefore be an option in the configuration settings to choose between

A) Schedule based on Story Rank

B) Schedule based on Epic Rank

For example, Epic A might relate to the Initial Investigation phase of a project, Epic B to the Detailed Investigation, and so on.
While you can use an Agile board to order the underlying Stories into the correct sequence, it would be much easier if there were an option in Portfolio to simply schedule everything under Epic A first, then everything under Epic B second etc.

This would also cover the current problem that newly-created Stories always go to the bottom of the backlog and therefore are scheduled last by default, regardless of what Epic they belong to. For example, in the scenario above, if during the Initial Investigation stage a new work package/story is identified and created under Epic A, you would want Portfolio to automatically schedule that alongside the other Stories under Epic A.
fields.summary: Option to schedule by Epic rank rather than Story

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1368].
  {panel}

The following changes can be made to make Portfolio more accessible to people with disabilities:

- Make everything accessible via the keyboard. Includes
-- Table column headers
-- Expanding/collapsing table rows
-- Re-ranking table rows
-- Information displayed on mouse hover
-- Reports
- Keyboard navigation should not become trapped in an input field
- Input fields should have names to inform blind users what field they are on
- Text-less buttons should have a name

Generally speaking, the goal is to reach [Section 508 compliance|http://www.508checker.com/what-is-508-compliance].
fields.summary: Improve accessibility

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1383].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no wallboard view/configuration for live plan in JIRA Portfolio.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have this configuration so that customer would be able to display the latest view/updates in a graph/short summary manner of the live plan in a big/public display to let everyone be aware of it.
fields.summary: wallboard view for live plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This feature request is for *JIRA Advanced Roadmaps for Cloud*. Using *JIRA Advanced Roadmaps for Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1862].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Advanced Roadmaps only allows to set *one* team on an issue; whenever you set a team on an issue with children, that team will be set on *all* children and any other previously set team will be overwritten in Portfolio, and once that change got committed back to Jira, also in Jira.

If you set different teams on child issues of an issue that itself does not have a team set (e.g., set two different teams on the child epics of an initiative), the parent will *show* both teams as an aggregate of the teams set on its children (hence the blue background that indicates these values are not actually set on the parent) but actually *still* has no team set. If you try to set a team now, it will be set on the parent and set the same team on all children. It is *not* possible to set multiple teams on an issue

This suggestion proposes to relax this limitation and allow setting multiple teams on issues.
fields.summary: Allow to set multiple teams on issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1415].
  {panel}

	​As a Scrum Master/Release Manager/Product Owner/Project Coordinator/Tribe Leader, I want to display the User Stories in a drop menu under the Epic, in the Epic Report Display.
 in order to visualize dependencies, maximize the resources assignments and eventually adjust the scope & priorities of my backlog.

*Dod : *	
The Epic report shows the possibility to display, with a drop menu, all user stories inside the Epic Report display (see attachment)
fields.summary: Aggregate epic and story data in a single view (expand epics in visual timeline)

fields.description:
For scenarios where the customer only have one team for their sprints, the view the schedule by teams or resources will be already set to that team always.
This will avoid a poor experience for our customers.
fields.summary: In case it only exists one team, the Overview will be always grouped by that team

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1354].
  {panel}

Feedback from one of our users:

I've been looking at the time estimates and it seems that the "Time Estimates" column in Portfolio maps to the remaining estimates at the story level. It's great how Portfolio:
a. Calculates the remaining estimates and adds them to view at the Epic level and it 
b. Allows you to add additional estimates at the Epic level too
However, it would be brilliant if it could:
1. Show the Original Estimate and allow it to be added / removed on the column view
2. Show the Work Logged and allow this field to be added / removed onthe column view
3. Rename the existing Time Estimates column header to Remaining so it more clearly maps to the JIRA ticket information itself (took me a while to figure out what it was doing...)
fields.summary: Time estimation - original vs remaining estimate

fields.description:
Right now, Portfolio can only use as issue source issues associated to JIRA where the add-on is installed.

Some customers may have multiple installations of JIRA and it would good to manipulate all instances data into a single Portfolio installation.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Portfolio to use multiple JIRA instances as issue source.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1187].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the date of the sprint will be displayed when you click on label under the capacity bar to see the dates that it refers to. This is per capacity bar, there is no way to view all the dates for all the capacity bar at same time.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the those date information on the capacity bar so that the information can be seen
fields.summary: Add the date information of the sprint on the capacity view
Allow to show completed issues for a specific date range
Ability to easily add Recurring Absence/Exception

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1808].
  {panel}

As a Team Manager, I'd like to know the capacity of my teams, group by skills, in order to be able to easily determine bottlenecks (or overcapacity) so that :
 * I can accept or not any new project.
 * Decide to hire or not.

For that, a graph with the team's occupation group by skills would be perfect.
fields.summary: Report team's capacity by skills

fields.description:
We are running into this issue but cannot resolved it on our reports.
 
This is the message that is displayed but there are linked tickets that should have display values.
We couldn't find any dependencies in your plan, based on the time it was last calculated.
Last calculation: 20/Sep/17 09:55 AM
fields.summary: Dependencies Reports not Displaying

fields.description: Provide the ability to color the delivery plan
fields.summary: Roadmap
Dependency Mapping Tool
Display team members when schedule is grouped by team
Pick and choose sprints in the plan

fields.description:
As a user, I've migrated from Server to Cloud but was surprised that Portfolio for Jira Cloud 3.0 is not available.
I am finding that this may result in the cancellation of our Jira Portfolio Cloud license.
Portfolio for Jira Server 3.0 introduces a lot of features and a very simple plan configuration and visualization that explains better the dependency of the issues and why the issue is scheduled in the way that is presented.
Portfolio for Jira 2.0 does not have those features and is very hard to work with.
fields.summary: As a user, I've migrated from Server to Cloud but was surprised that Portfolio for Jira Cloud 3.0 is not available
Progress visible on schedule view (Live Plans)

fields.description: As a user, I would like to have a shortcut to discard all Uncommitted Changes without have to access the *Uncommitted Changes* menu.
fields.summary: Shortcut to discard Uncommitted Changes.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-972].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Users can only search using search box to find the epic they want to set the dependency to
!jpo.png|thumbnail!

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to search using filter. In the case where the plan consists of many epics, it would be easier to search using filter.
fields.summary: Ability to retrieve epics using filter in JIRA Portfolio Dependency

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1770].
  {panel}

h3. h3. Problem

We are not able to add the priority field on the scope since it's not an option in Portfolio.
h3. !Screen Shot 2016-12-23 at 1.09.54 PM.png!
h3. h3. Suggestion

Add the field priority between the options in Portfolio
h3. h3. Workaround

There isn't any.
fields.summary: Add "Priority" field to the Scope view in Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users are unable to list dependencies and the errors (e.g.: cyclic dependency)

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a report to list all dependencies and the warnings.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Report on dependencies and its errors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1308].
  {panel}

An Epic/Story can currently hold two constraints ("Requires" and "Required By"). I would like to add another constraint to tell portfolio to schedule epics/stories to start at the same time.

For example:
- I want Team 1 to work on a design 1 for product 1
- I want Team 2 to work on a design 2 for product 1
- Both issues should start at the same time and (if both have the same estimate) end at the same time in order to evaluate design 1 and design 2 and pick a winner
fields.summary: As a user I want to explicitly schedule 2 epics/stories to start at the same time
Bulk change order of epics and child initiatives
Theme - Mapping to existing JIRA fields
show the ranking number in the first column
Stream for releases(like traditional version of portfolio)
Add 'Import Themes' from other Portfolio's

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1752].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When there are 3 hierarchy (Initiative -> Epic -> Task -> Subtask), users set the estimation for Initiative to 300 hours. When users start adding more Epic/Task/Subtask with estimation, the estimation for Initiative should be reduced by its children estimation.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to automatically reduce the parent estimation with its children' and allow users to see the planned estimates vs the logged estimation added by users on its children.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to automatically reduce the parent estimation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1236].
  {panel}

As an administrator, I think it would be valuable to be able to color code initiatives and epics, as it would make it easier to locate specific epics when there are quite a few in a plan. A few examples of how we could customise the color are:

To be able to set or select a colour to represent Initiatives and Epics.
When an Initiative colour is set, apply that colour by default to the Epics in the Initiative.
Sync the colours between Portfolio and JIRA.
fields.summary: Epic and Initiative Custom Colors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1778].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

As a user, I'd like to import all issues into the plan and make Portfolio automatically pull the Assignee *without* clicking _Calculate_ button. This is due to, I don't wish Portfolio to automatically schedule everything for me; I wish to manually do it.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to automatically pull the assignee without clicking Calculate
fields.summary: Provide a feature to automatically pull the assignee without clicking Calculate
Epic automatically detected by Epic link
Include sprint timeline from capacity view for Epic/Initiative view
Portfolio Administrator permission should give access to Shared Team Management
Hide epics in Portfolio timeline view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When user clicks an issue in Scope graph, Portfolio will open up Issue Details (see below) automatically. As a user, I want Portfolio to just highlight the issue without opening up Issue Details.
*  !image-2018-06-21-18-51-36-312.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide option to disable issue details when user click on an issue in Scope graph
fields.summary: Option to disable issue details when user click on an issue in Scope graph

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, both *Original Estimate* and *Estimate* field need to be filed in Portfolio plan separately. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the *Estimate* field, when *Original Estimate* is entered
fields.summary: Automatically update Estimate field when Original Estimate value is added
Provide an option to disable scheduling of issues without assignee
Display issue estimate in Schedule/Stories report

fields.description: As a Portfolio user I would like to be able to select the project from the search field so that I don't have to spend much time looking for a project on the list (in case I have many of them on one list), so basically the same as is there for the Release choosing.
fields.summary: Project selector | Make it selector with search

fields.description:
Doing a comparison between the load of the Release/Sprint/Components dropdown, for example, indeed the performance of the Parent dropdown is very different.

h3. Actual behaviour
The reason for this load fast is that Portfolio load them initially on page load and do not pull in new field values after that. So there is no backend call involved. 
While the parent dropdown uses a JQL to load issues from the backend. This happens because issues can change frequently (being renamed, new issues are added, old ones deleted, for example) and it would provide a terrible UX if Portfolio only loaded that once;  you would miss out on most recent changes made to issues in Jira. 

h3. Improved behaviour
Implement a dedicated endpoint for just loading parents that gets rid of all things not needed to show parents would improve performance to our customers here.
fields.summary: Improve performance call of the Parent dropdown in Scope

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1871].
  {panel}

At the moment it is not possible to have a dynamic team, when new people join or leave the team at some point in time.

In Consulting business we need plan our resources for the future, and it is not always possible to have a full team working unchanged until project end. 

Thus we would like to have a possibility to have a Start Date of a person in a team. And maybe End Date too. This could then be part of the calculation for capacity.

P.S. Also team member vacations should be taken into account.
fields.summary: Start/End Date for Team Members

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

[Cross-project releases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/creating-and-configuring-cross-project-releases-828785313.html] feature allows users to create releases against multiple projects.

However, we still need to release/archive each release in the cross-project release one by one and it's troublesome.

h4. Suggested Solution

It would be better to do release/archive operations agains cross-project releases.
fields.summary: Improve operations for  cross-project releases

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no possibility in JIRA to set gaps between the Sprints in the plan. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer would like to have the possibility to add a gap of a week, for example
fields.summary: Add possibility to set gaps between Sprints in Portfolio schedule
Allow assignment of Start and Stop Dates to Virtual Users
Team Members - Bulk Updates

fields.description:
h4. Scenario

Currently, Portfolio schedules issues concurrently when the issues do not have dependencies. 

This works very well for teams with multiple members, but when the plan has only one team and this team has only one team member it does not work very well because a single person cannot work multiple tasks at the same time.

h4. Suggestion

In this scenario, it would be very useful if it would be possible to set a maximum of concurrently assigned issues to a single team member. 

Also, in this scenario, it would be helpful if Portfolio adds dependencies (blockers) automatically to the issues.
fields.summary: I as Portfolio user, I want better support for single user team in the plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-503].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

As it is now, changes in Epic Links are not synchronized between the JIRA issues and epics and Portfolio Epics and Stories.
When portfolio stories and their epics are linked to JIRA issues and epics, then the epic link relations should_ always be consistent_ between JIRA and portfolio.

* When I change the epic link of a JIRA issue in JIRA, this should be reflected in the hierarchy in Portfolio
* When I move a story to an Epic in Portfolio, this should be reflected in the Epic link in the JIRA issue.

Ideally, the synchronization would be automatic and instant.
However, being able to update the links using the manually activated "update" functionality could be an acceptable workaround.

In my opinion, this missing consistency is by far the most important missing piece of "JIRA Agile integration." and deserves individual attention.
We are evaluating Portfolio right now and I can vividly imagine the nightmare it would be to keep the epic links in JIRA and Portfolio consistent by manually checking and fixing them every day.
fields.summary: Epic link should be synchronized between JIRA and Portfolio
Scope Release Progress Shows # of # Issues Bar
Error - "Bummer, something has gone terribly wrong here..." on some Browsers
Unlock the Team field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1463].
  {panel}

I set up a live plan which is sourced from two JIRA boards. At the time of import, some issues I import are resolved (status "Accepted" in my screenshot).
Unlike other issues, these ones are not assigned a Team. 
This behavior partially voids the use of the team filter, which now only helps selecting items that were resolved AFTER the plan was created, but not those resolved BEFORE.

It would be then very helpful if these stories were equally assigned a team (at plan creation). The team (or teams) could be set based on the issue source, as a source is normally associated to one or more teams.
fields.summary: Set field "Team" on resolved issues that are imported in Live plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1684].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
When excluding issues from a plan in Portfolio, you are not able to exclude just a single issue if the ticket is in a hierarchy like Epic, Task, Sub-task.

h3. Suggestion
Allow to exclude individual issues from Portfolio Plans

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Let Child/Parent issues be excluded individually from a plan
Improve ranking facilities - Move in bulk and assign rank without drag and drop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-518].
  {panel}

In the list of issues in JIRA Portfolio, I can manually assign possible team members to a task by checking the check mark next to their name.
See this screenshot from your documentation:
!https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/files/715262710/Assign+Teammembers.png!

In JIRA we already use a custom field with multiple users that we call "Assignee options". We fill that field with the users that are able to take on the issue. We use that field to create Todo lists etc. on people's dashboards.

I would like the contents of such a field to be used for "manually" selecting possible assignees in Portfolio.

Let me know if my request is not clear or if I need to explain it further.
fields.summary: Automatically fill in "Members" assignment from JIRA custom field
Team sharing or reusing already defined teams
Allow Filter by Sprint Name.

fields.description: As a Portfolio user, I want to be able to reorder Initiatives, Epics, and Stories in the Gantt Chart by dragging-and-dropping.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio user, I want to be able to reorder Initiatives, Epics, and Stories in the Gantt Chart

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1273].
  {panel}

h2. Summary

Currently the scheduling algorithm uses the stack-ranking of epics to determine scheduling constraints. If an individual creates an initiative later that supersedes another intiative then they have to manually pull up all the epics in that initiative above the epics in another initiative to reflect this relative initiative prioritzation. It would be very helpful if in the scheduling configuration section if you could designate priority on an initiative basis as opposed to an epic basis.

h2. Background
Our organization is very initiative focused and we determine organizational priorities based on the initiatives. We recently had a late initiative come into place that superseded all other initiatives. As we began to build the plan, bucket work into epics and then stories, some of these high priority epics were seemingly started later than expected causing an unrealistic timeline. This caused a lot of manual work to change the epic prioritization to match the initiative priortization.
fields.summary: Allow scheduling algorithm to use initiative backlog for prioritization as opposed to epic backlog
Option needed to to show unsized stories on the schedule view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-496].

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

The problem: if a linked issue is moved to a new project in JIRA, its key and status will no longer be displayed correctly in Portfolio. To work around the problem, the issue-link can simply be deleted and re-added from within Portfolio. It would however be nice if this step was not required.
fields.summary: Issue links should work correctly when an issue has been moved to a new project in JIRA
Filter Epics on Reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1526].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

From time to time, users would want to find issues with empty Theme, Team, Story Point and other column selection so that they can fill them up accordingly. If there are a lot of issues in the Plan, it is a little bit difficult to find them.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to filter out issues with empty Theme, Team, Story Point and other column selection.
fields.summary: An option to filter out issues with empty Story Point and Theme in a Scope View
Custom workflow status taken into progress account in Port
Add default estimates to 2.0 plans
As a user a JIRA Portfolio manager 2.0, I want to be able to export the all Epics and stories with progress to excel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1810].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The user wants the option to create a template for plans in Portfolio.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please, provide an option to create a plan template.
h3. Why this is important

This would be very useful since users could save some time since it wouldn't be necessary create a new plan from scratch every time.
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Templates for plans in Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Portfolio [Scheduling behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/scheduling-behavior-828785428.html] takes into account multiple aspects. The customer would want to configure it to only consider the issue priorities

h3. Suggested Solution

Add possibility for Portfolio to be configurable to only calculate the plan only based on issue Priorities.
fields.summary: Portfolio should be configurable to only calculate the plan only based on issue Priorities.
